question: Have you seen Barry? We've got to talk.
You said we were special.
answer: I meant everything. You know what I said, though.

question: I can't, Barry...
Does Chloe kiss as good as I do?
Oh, you...
Somebody'll see.
Somebody's there, Barry.
answer: Come on, Claudette. A man's not made of stone.

question: Let's go back, Barry...
answer: I need you so much, Claudette.

question: I musta seen that Kojak 82 times.
answer: Excuse me. How far is Camp Crystal Lake?

question: COP What is it, Eddie? Forty I heard they were gonna try miles? it.
answer: Can I get a bus or something?

question: All the girls up there gonna look as good as you?
Goddamnit, Ralph! Get outta here. Don't worry about him. He's harmless. G'won. Git! Climb on up, Miss. Must be the fourth time somebody's tried to reopen that place.
Something always happens up there. Don't let the spooks getcha, Annie.
answer: No sweat. Thanks a lot for the lift. Hiya! I'm headed for Camp Crystal Lake. Can you help me out? I can't remember being this excited about anything. I want to be a teacher when I finish at Southern State. I guess I've always wanted to work with children. I hate it when people call 'em kids. Sounds like little goats. The job market for teachers is supposed to be the pits these days, but I don't care. When you have a dream as long as I have, you'll do anything... Wasn't that Camp Crystal Lake? Just back there? I think we better stop... Please stop... Please! Stop! Please!

question: There you are dead wrong.
Sometimes I only think about kissing women.
Wanta give me a hand here? Alice? Wanta roll this sucker out of the way. Alice?

Push on this side. Alice, this is Jack, Marcie and Ned. Push. That's got her. Thanks. I'm Steve Christy. Welcome to Camp Crystal Lake. You got some grubby clothes? Climb into 'em. Alice, see if Bill has cleaned out the boathouse. I want him to start with the canoes. What happened to Brenda?
answer: You told her to sweep the courts.

question: You can changed in three. Steve said for you to start on the boats.
I'll tell him.
Everybody except the girl who's supposed to handle the kitchen. Annie.
answer: You think you're gonna last all summer?

question: You draw very well.
answer: Oh, thanks. I wish I could spend more time at it.

question: This isn't your cup of tea, hunh? Any particular reason?
You want to leave?
answer: I don't know. Probably be best for everybody.

question: You may not care a lot about this place, Alice, but I mean to make it my whole life. It's been my whole life. Gimme a chance. Stay a week. Help get it ready. Next Friday, if you're not happy, I'll put you on the bus myself. I'll be grateful.
Thanks, Alice. I've got to go to town and pick up the trailer and all that other stuff, but I'll be back around ten. If you're still up, we can talk, okay?
You're crazy!
answer: Did anyone ever tell you you're beautiful when you're angry?

question: I don't believe you...
answer: Want to see my trick shot? It's even better.

question: You ever fire one of those bows again, and I'll tack you up on the wall to dry.
answer: God, but I love that sexy talk.

question: Sorry. How you doing?
Steve said you were thinking of leaving. True?
You okay? You're lucky. How come you're leaving?
answer: It's long and personal. It has nothing to do with you or the other kids.

question: Maybe I can help?
answer: And it's this place. It makes no sense, but it spooks me.

question: I didn't know I was asleep...What time is it?
Now I'm only eleven hours behind schedule. Steve is going to have a small cow.
answer: You can only do what you can do.

question: And then Steve looks at you with those hurt eyes--like you don't care about children... I'll see you later.
You're very nice.
Give me a hand?
answer: For sure. This is almost like the one at my uncle's cabin in Maine.

question: Here we go. Now ya' close the switch. I'll be okay. Holy shit...
answer: Don't get up. Take a second...

question: You saved my life.
Thanks.
answer: I figured if I didn't save you. I'd have to give you mouth-to-mouth and that would have ruined my appetite.

question: Whew.
answer: This puddle was enough to ground you all the way to China.

question: Floor probably leaks. This area is full of springs.
answer: A short somewhere. There's the problem, Jack. Wire worked itself loose.

question: Shows how much you know. It's something about tomorrow.
Right! Right!
answer: This just plain ain't my day.

question: Hey, look, I'm sorry. I'll never do it again. I'm sorry.
answer: Ned? We're gonna be working together for a while. You're a nice guy without all the entertainment, okay?

question: Tell 'em I'm sorry?
I'm gonna go lie down and catch some z's. Today wiped me out. Thanks, Alice.
Yeah, like draining the lake!
answer: Hey, how about a walk by the lake? Just a walk, for Chrissakes.

question: Boy, we sure do have a lot of filthy small-minded people around here. Wait a minute, I'll get my diaphragm and be right with you.
answer: Wind's up. It's shifted a good hundred and eighty degrees.

question: Makes me want to hold on and never let go.
I love you. What about Neddy?
He keeps on acting like such an asshole!
Don't call him.
answer: I thought you wanted to give him one of your motherly lectures. Ned is gonna do whatever he wants to do, you know.

question: I guess...
I'm a little scared of storms. Always have been. Since I was a kid.

I've dreamed this dream. Maybe half a dozen times. There is a thunderstorm. The rain comes down like pebbles. I can hear the sound. I try to close my ears off. It doesn't work. The sounds gets louder. The rain turns to blood and the blood washes down in little rivers. And the sound stops.
I call it my shower dream.
answer: This is no dream. Want to escape for a while?

question: Lead the way! Are you wet?
answer: Just a little. Wait a minute, woman.

question: Mmmmmmmph?
Best over...
Like waves. It's never been likes waves before.
Anything else you want?
You can't go back there tonight. Not in that stuff. 'Less you wanta get drownded.
Aw.
answer: I have six new counsellor up there. They're all babes in the woods in every sense of the word.

question: They'll be okay if they know enough to stay in outta the rain. One night on the town.
...I know what you mean. Two and a quarter. Plus fifteen percent tip to make up for me spending the night alone. You got a roof for that Jeep?
answer: Yeah. I got it on before this-- --all started.

question: That's thirty percent.
Well, it hasn't been that long.
I think we should go wake them up. Just in case.
answer: Give them a little while longer. It's still early, anyway.

question: I don't here it anymore.
answer: Can't hear anything through that wind and rain.

question: It sounded like Brenda.
Did somebody leave the lights on at the softball field?
They're off now.
Okay. I'll go with you.
answer: If it'll make you feel better.

question: Bad enough we got a full moon; it's Friday the 13th. They keep statistics. We get more accidents, more robberies, more rapes, more homicides, more of everything when there's a full moon. It affects people. Makes 'em nuts.
answer: You've made a science out of coincidence.

question: This is Tierney. Roger. Acknowledge receipt. Estimate arrival time fifteen minutes. How copy? Have to drop you here, Steve.
Another coincidence.
Brenda? Brenda? You there? Bill. What the fuck is going on here?
Marcie?
Marcie? Brenda? Jack? I think we should call the police, Bill.
answer: Okay. Sucker's locked. Who's got the key? It's dead. Try the pay phone.

question: Do you have a dime? A quarter?
answer: No. There must be some in the desk somewhere.

question: Hello? Hello? This damn thing's dead, too. What's the matter with it?
Why don't we run? Just run now?
answer: It's over twenty miles to the crossroads. Steve'll be back in an hour. Things will straighten out then. We'll take his Jeep and get help. Don't worry. There is probably some really stupid explanation for all this. When the sun comes up tomorrow, you'll smile. Promise.

question: Bill?! The generator... Bill? Bill? Bill! Bill? Help! Help! Jack! Marcie! Help me! The knife!
answer: There now, my dear. Please. I can't help you if you can't talk to me. There, there now...

question: He's dead... She's dead... all dead... Please save me... oh... poor Bill... Oh my God, oh my God... oh God...
answer: It will be all right. I'll take care of you.

question: Jack? Marcie? Ned?
answer: It's just this place. The storm. That's why you're all upset.

question: No, no, they're all dead...
They'll kill you! Don't leave me!
All dead? Neddy? Oh, Marcie...
answer: Oh, my lord... So young, so pretty. What monster could have done such a thing?

question: Bill--Bill--Bill is out there...
answer: We shall go straight to the police.

question: The killer is still out there.
answer: I will protect you. Oh, this place... It should never have been a camp. Not for children. They had so much trouble here. Camp Blood. You know a boy drowned the year before those two others were killed? An accident? It was inadequate supervision. The counsellors were not paying enough attention... They were making love when that boy drowned. We should go now.

question: Maybe we should wait for Mr. Christy.
I am, Jason. I am.
answer: Why shouldn't we wait for Mr. Christy?

question: It was my son they killed. They said he drowned, but I know it was inadequate supervision...
answer: Mr. Christy will be back soon.

question: No, he won't. I killed him as well.... I couldn't let them start this camp again, could I?
answer: I won't let you! No! No! No!
